Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, probably a kantharos; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of middle part of draped female figure with added red on drapery, faded white dotted circles and white dots on vertical fold, to right; painted inscription in field referring to figure to right, the slightest traces of which are preserved..
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the lettering, see British Museum 1888,0601.444 (Beazley and Payne 1929, 258 no. 14).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.50)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 258, no. 15)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 355, no. B453)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 226, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0745) (Phase 1)
